## FallbackErrorStrategy.canHandle() method

Determines if this strategy can handle the error. Since this is the fallback strategy, it always returns true.

**Signature:**

```typescript
canHandle(err: Error): boolean;
```

</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

err


</td><td>

Error


</td><td>

The error to check


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

boolean

Always returns true
